questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15395

Which of the following can be said according to the given situation?

Your friend wants to study abroad, but she isn't sure if she can afford it. Her family income doesn't seem to be enough to support her, either. She asks for your opinion; you want to encourage her and also want to relieve her financially. You say:

 

A) Why don't you consider some local universities?
B) Don't bother your family, you know their financial condition.
C) I think studying somewhere around here is better for your family.
D) I'm sure you'll manage it, you can work part-time for your expenses as well.
E) Try to understand your parents. They will miss you if you go abroad.
A B C D E
questionText: Which of the following can be said according to the given situation? Your friend wants to study abroad, but she isn't sure if she can afford it. Her family income doesn't seem to be enough to support her, either. She asks for your opinion; you want to encourage her and also want to relieve her financially. You say: A) Why don't you consider some local universities? B) Don't bother your family, you know their financial condition. C) I think studying somewhere around here is better for your family. D) I'm sure you'll manage it, you can work part-time for your expenses as well. E) Try to understand your parents. They will miss you if you go abroad. A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15396

 Find the correct Turkish translation of the given sentence below. 

Youngsters are the biggest portion of society and have fashion-conscious since they demand to be free in clothes.

A) Gençler toplumun en büyük kesimini oluşturdukları için modayı takip ederler çünkü kıyafetlerinde özgür olmak isterler.
B) Gençler toplumun en büyük kesimini oluştururlar ve modayı takip ettikleri kadar, kıyafetlerinde de özgür olmayı talep ederler.
C) Gençler toplumun en büyük kesimini oluşturmasalar da, kıyafetlerde özgür olmayı talep ettikleri için modayı takip ederler.
D) Gençler toplumun en büyük kesimini oluştururlar ve kıyafetlerde özgür olmayı talep ettikleri için moda bilincine sahiptirler.
E) Modayı, özgür olmak ve istedikleri kıyafetleri seçmek için takip eden gençler, toplumun en büyük kesimini oluştururlar.
A B C D E

A) Gençler toplumun en büyük kesimini oluşturdukları için modayı takip ederler çünkü kıyafetlerinde özgür olmak isterler. B) Gençler toplumun en büyük kesimini oluştururlar ve modayı takip ettikleri kadar, kıyafetlerinde de özgür olmayı talep ederler. C) Gençler toplumun en büyük kesimini oluşturmasalar da, kıyafetlerde özgür olmayı talep ettikleri için modayı takip ederler. D) Gençler toplumun en büyük kesimini oluştururlar ve kıyafetlerde özgür olmayı talep ettikleri için moda bilincine sahiptirler. questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15397

Which of the following is the correct order of the dialogue ?

I- Well, I don't agree with you. What you wear says who you are.

II- Do you like trendy jackets, Jack?

III- Because I want to give you something special on your birthday.

IV- Not actually. I like the classical ones. Why do you ask?

V- Being stylish doesn't mean wearing up-to-date clothes and following fashion trends.

VI- There is no need for this, but thanks anyway.

VII- Why do you say so? Don't you like being stylish?

A) II - IV - III - VI - VII - V - I
B) II - IV - III - VII - VI - V - I
C) II - IV - VII - III - V - I - VI
D) II - III - IV - VI - VII - V - I
E) II - III - IV - VI - V - I - VII
A B C D E
questionText: Which of the following is the correct order of the dialogue ? I- Well, I don't agree with you. What you wear says who you are. II- Do you like trendy jackets, Jack? III- Because I want to give you something special on your birthday. IV- Not actually. I like the classical ones. Why do you ask? V- Being stylish doesn't mean wearing up-to-date clothes and following fashion trends. VI- There is no need for this, but thanks anyway. VII- Why do you say so? Don't you like being stylish? A) II - IV - III - VI - VII - V - I B) II - IV - III - VII - VI - V - I C) II - IV - VII - III - V - I - VI D) II - III - IV - VI - VII - V - I E) II - III - IV - VI - V - I - VII A B C D E

questionAsHtml:

 Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

After eighteen years, the musical, Phantom of the Opera, has become the longest-running show in Broadway history. It is also among the most successful entertainment productions of any kind ever. Across the world, Phantom is calculated to have made three point two billion dollars. Compare that to the highest-grossing Hollywood movie, Titanic, which grossed less than half of that figure. Phantom originally opened to mixed reviews, but eighteen years later it is still playing to big audiences every night.

The best title for this passage is ...... .

A)  Big Audiences Love The Phantom of the Opera
B)  Titanic and The Phantom of the Opera
C)  The World of Musicals
D)  The Big Success of The Phantom of the Opera
E)  Entertainment Failures
A B C D E

Cybercrime is defined as a crime in which a computer is the object of the crime (hacking, phishing, spamming) or is used as a tool to commit an offense. Cybercriminals may use computer technology to access personal information, business trade secrets or use the internet for exploitative or malicious purposes. Criminals can also use computers for communication and document or data storage. Criminals who perform these illegal activities are often referred to as hackers. Cybercrime may also be referred to as computer crime. Cybercrime is a fast-growing area of crime. More and more criminals are exploiting the speed, convenience and anonymity of the Internet to commit a diverse range of criminal activities that know no borders, either physical or virtual, cause serious harm and pose very real threats to victims worldwide.

B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -

questionAsHtml:

Aşağıda verilen soruları aşağıda verilen metne göre cevaplayınız.

Cyber crime is one of the biggest threats to people nowadays. With organizations becoming more and more technology dependent, experiencing an increase of 22% in cyber crime cases in a year is not surprising. Your home is filled with many valuable items but your computer and email account contain crucial personal information, important work documents, and even your passwords. There are various threats under the title of cyber crimes. Take phishing for the first instance. It involves tricking a computer user into performing some risky action that undermines all their previous security precautions. Secondly, keylogging... you might be sent an innocuous e-mail, even one that looks like it has come from an organization or individual you trust. These e-mails contain links or attachments that, when clicked on, cause malicious code to be downloaded. It could be designed to sit quietly on your computer and steal passwords or banking logins.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 27456

One day The Hodja was walking around in the market place. He saw a bright-coloured bird for sale for 12 gold coins. Hodja was amazed. He approached the crowd, gathered around the bird and its seller.

`How can a bird be so expensive?’ he asked the people watching the bird.

`This is a special bird,’ they explained, `It can talk like a human being!’ This gave Hodja an idea. He went straight to his home, grabbed his turkey and brought him to the market place. He stood near the man selling the parrot.

`Turkey, for sale, ten gold coins!’ he yelled.

`Hodja Effendi, how can a turkey worth ten gold coins?’ the shoppers protested.

`There is a bird there for 12 gold.’ insisted the admant Hodja.

`But Hodja Effendi, that bird can talk like a human being.’ the people tried to reason. But Hodja was cold blooded.

`And this turkey can think like a human being.’ he countered.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

It is well prepared, it tastes delicious, and there are many different kinds of food like hamburgers, tacos, pizza, and chicken. However, the atmosphere is still calm; it’s possible to study and do homework. Finally, there are many friendly people in the Student Center. Even the strangers say, “Hi!” and offer to share “their” tables. When that happens, practice in speaking English and friendship often follow. For these reasons, it is nice to go to the Student Center cafeteria to enjoy eating, studying, and talking with new people.

E) -

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15413

Alan: Hey Jane! Let me ask you a question. Do you prefer listening to music while studying?

Cathy: Of course not.

Alan: Why?

Cathy: I think, it worsens the performance as it interferes with tasks like reading comprehension or memorization.

Alan:Well,  hear this! According to a research, listening to music while studying helps to diminish stress and anxiety and it also helps students to focus on what they are doing.

Cathy: Really? I’m not so sure about it. Actually,  I think the opposite because it distracts students from concentrating on their work.

Alan: Then, you haven’t heard of Mozart effect before. It says that students who prefer classical music or some alpha wave audio like instrumental, soft and healing music while studying absorb more information and have longer and peaceful study sessions. Besides, it also improves creativity and productivity; reduces stress; calms your mind and controls your mood.

Cathy: You have a point but that’s not always true. You know our peers would rather listen to raucous and loud music like rock, rap, or heavy metal just like me. These kinds of music  certainly hinder the learning process. Especially for the people who are inclined to music, it is much more difficult to have an efficient result.

Alan: No doubt about it. Look here it says this study found out that students who attended a lecture with down tempo and relaxing music playing in the background got significantly higher scores than students who attended the same lecture without music.

Cathy: That sounds interesting. Well, actually I agree to a certain extent. As I stated before, it depends on the genre of music, age of the listener and personality.

Alan: Of course it does. However, in my opinion, if scientists claim something, I take their words for it.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

According to a research, listening to music while studying helps to diminish stress and anxiety and it also helps students to focus on what they are doing. Cathy : Really? I’m not so sure about it. Actually,  I think the opposite because it distracts students from concentrating on their work. Alan : Then, you haven’t heard of Mozart effect before. It says that students who prefer classical music or some alpha wave audio like instrumental, soft and healing music while studying absorb more information and have longer and peaceful study sessions. You know our peers would rather listen to raucous and loud music like rock, rap, or heavy metal just like me. These kinds of music  certainly hinder the learning process. Especially for the people who are inclined to music, it is much more difficult to have an efficient result. Alan : No doubt about it. Cathy : That sounds interesting. Well, actually I agree to a certain extent. As I stated before, it depends on the genre of music, age of the listener and personality. Alan : Of course it does. However, in my opinion, if scientists claim something, I take their words for it. A) - B) - C) - D) - E) - A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15451

MY BEST FRIEND

I have lots of friends; classmates, relatives and neighbors. I can’t imagine my life without them. But there is one, who will always be in the first place in my heart: Sandra, my best friend. She is a very beautiful girl with blonde hair and gorgeous brown eyes. She is taller and thinner than me. She looks flawless. Besides her beautiful appearance, she has a very nice character.

By nature, Sandra is communicative and outgoing, she likes being the center of attention. She dreams to become a singer and I personally believe that one day her dreams will come true. She has won many prizes and taken part in many concerts because she sings beautifully.

Although Sandra has a wonderful personality, she has some negative qualities.  She hardly ever goes on her dates on time because she is forgetful. At times, she can be distracted and inconsiderate, which makes people think she never takes things seriously. But this is not true at all. In contrast, she has a strong sense of responsibility and you can always count on her.

What I admire most about her is that she is protective and likes to support her friends to the end. Whether you believe or not, once she even saved my life! It was an unforgettable day for both of us. We went swimming on that day. Suddenly, my right leg went dead and I couldn’t go on swimming. I lost consciousness. When I opened my eyes, I found myself lying and Sandra holding my hands. She had pulled me out of the water on her own. That was a real narrow escape from the death, and if she hadn't been there, I would have drowned.

None of the things that I mentioned above makes us good friends indeed. You cannot get along with someone just for the sake of good personality traits. You need more than that. Remember, a friend in need is a friend indeed.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15469

FRIENDSHIP

When it comes to talking about the qualities of a good friend, most will mention favorable adjectives like honest, respectful, generous, thoughtful, kind, empathetic, etc. These people may be right but in my opinion, there are some qualities which are more important for a good friendship.

First of all, a friend must be sincere. Without sincerity, a friendship cannot last long or turn out to be a good friendship as pretensions or insincere mannerisms will end up in disappointment. Sincerity on its own is not enough but without sincerity, a true sharing, which is essential for a good friendship, cannot be achieved.

Secondly, reliability is a must for a good friendship. I believe that one cannot consider becoming even an acquaintance with someone who is not reliable, let alone good friends. After all, reliability is not only essential for a good friendship but also for a relationship. If you do not rely on someone, you can share almost nothing with them.

Another important factor is loyalty. Only loyal ones out of all friends will turn out to be good ones in time Friendship is a journey in life and this journey can never be without problems or barriers. Loyal ones will not leave you half way through. Therefore, a good friendship cannot be maintained without being loyal.

In conclusion, a good friendship requires various good personal qualities but I believe that some of them such as being sincere, reliable and loyal are more important. Without those, we cannot talk about a good friendship.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

3D technology has brought many improvements into our lives, like the 3D TV. It has incredible depth, stunning sound, clarity and color. Moreover, it is the product of glasses-free, ultra-thin and energy-efficient engineering. The entertainment business will never be the same. If you're a gamer, it will give you great satisfaction with its resolution because it has '4K' (a format four times the resolutions of current HD sets) resolution. On the other hand, there stands the 3D cell phone. With this phone, the video you've shot can be seen on the phone screen without the need for special glasses. However, because of the visual angle limit, only one person can still see it clearly in 3D, unlike a 3D TV. You will be able to capture 3D content with a special double camera on the back of the phone.

According to the passage, 3D TV possesses ...... .

A)  a technique for consuming less energy
B)  nearly the same features as a 3D cell phone does
C)  energy twice as much as a 4K TV
D)  colors worse than a 3D cell phone  
E)  engineers that have conservative energy methods
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:

  Read the paragraph and answer the question.

    Hi, I’m Lindsay. I’m a 9th grade student. My mom takes me to school every morning and then, she goes to work. Yesterday I was late for school. Because when my mom and I were about to get on the car, we noticed that another car had been parked just behind ours on the street. We had to wait for the driver to arrive for about ten minutes. Then, he pulled his car into an empty parking space, and we got on ours, fastened our seat belts and guess what…? It didn’t work! Mom told me to get out of the car and push it. At first, I thought mom was kidding me, but when I looked at her in the rear view mirror, I understood that she was extremely serious. Desperately, I did what she said but nothing changed, the car didn’t work again. So, we had to call a taxi. When I finally arrived at school, it was nearly 9.30. That meant I had missed nearly the half of the first lesson.

Choose the question that does not have an answer in the paragraph.

A) Did Lindsay’s teacher get angry with her for she was late to class?
B) What grade is Lindsay in?
C) How long did Lindsay and her mom wait for the driver of the other car?
D) What did Lindsay think when her mom told her to push the car?
E) What time did Lindsay arrive at school?
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15451

MY BEST FRIEND

I have lots of friends; classmates, relatives and neighbors. I can’t imagine my life without them. But there is one, who will always be in the first place in my heart: Sandra, my best friend. She is a very beautiful girl with blonde hair and gorgeous brown eyes. She is taller and thinner than me. She looks flawless. Besides her beautiful appearance, she has a very nice character.

By nature, Sandra is communicative and outgoing, she likes being the center of attention. She dreams to become a singer and I personally believe that one day her dreams will come true. She has won many prizes and taken part in many concerts because she sings beautifully.

Although Sandra has a wonderful personality, she has some negative qualities.  She hardly ever goes on her dates on time because she is forgetful. At times, she can be distracted and inconsiderate, which makes people think she never takes things seriously. But this is not true at all. In contrast, she has a strong sense of responsibility and you can always count on her.

What I admire most about her is that she is protective and likes to support her friends to the end. Whether you believe or not, once she even saved my life! It was an unforgettable day for both of us. We went swimming on that day. Suddenly, my right leg went dead and I couldn’t go on swimming. I lost consciousness. When I opened my eyes, I found myself lying and Sandra holding my hands. She had pulled me out of the water on her own. That was a real narrow escape from the death, and if she hadn't been there, I would have drowned.

None of the things that I mentioned above makes us good friends indeed. You cannot get along with someone just for the sake of good personality traits. You need more than that. Remember, a friend in need is a friend indeed.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

Whether you believe or not, once she even saved my life! It was an unforgettable day for both of us. We went swimming on that day. Suddenly, my right leg went dead and I couldn’t go on swimming. I lost consciousness. When I opened my eyes, I found myself lying and Sandra holding my hands. She had pulled me out of the water on her own. That was a real narrow escape from the death, and if she hadn't been there, I would have drowned. None of the things that I mentioned above makes us good friends indeed. You cannot get along with someone just for the sake of good personality traits. You need more than that. Remember, a friend in need is a friend indeed. A) - B) - C) - D) - E) - A B C D E

Because when my mom and I were about to get on the car, we noticed that another car had been parked just behind ours on the street. We had to wait for the driver to arrive for about ten minutes. Then, he pulled his car into an empty parking space, and we got on ours, fastened our seat belts and guess what…? It didn’t work! Mom told me to get out of the car and push it. At first, I thought mom was kidding me, but when I looked at her in the rear view mirror, I understood that she was extremely serious. Desperately, I did what she said but nothing changed, the car didn’t work again. So, we had to call a taxi. When I finally arrived at school, it was nearly 9.30. That meant I had missed nearly the half of the first lesson.

It is clear in the passage that…

A) Lindsay goes to school by bus every morning.
B) Lindsay and her mom never fasten their seat belts when they get on the car.
C) the car didn’t work because they ran out of petrol.
D) Lindsay and her mom had to leave the car there and call a taxi.
E) Lindsay didn’t help her mom while trying to start the car. 
A B C D E

E) VI

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15451

MY BEST FRIEND

I have lots of friends; classmates, relatives and neighbors. I can’t imagine my life without them. But there is one, who will always be in the first place in my heart: Sandra, my best friend. She is a very beautiful girl with blonde hair and gorgeous brown eyes. She is taller and thinner than me. She looks flawless. Besides her beautiful appearance, she has a very nice character.

By nature, Sandra is communicative and outgoing, she likes being the center of attention. She dreams to become a singer and I personally believe that one day her dreams will come true. She has won many prizes and taken part in many concerts because she sings beautifully.

Although Sandra has a wonderful personality, she has some negative qualities.  She hardly ever goes on her dates on time because she is forgetful. At times, she can be distracted and inconsiderate, which makes people think she never takes things seriously. But this is not true at all. In contrast, she has a strong sense of responsibility and you can always count on her.

What I admire most about her is that she is protective and likes to support her friends to the end. Whether you believe or not, once she even saved my life! It was an unforgettable day for both of us. We went swimming on that day. Suddenly, my right leg went dead and I couldn’t go on swimming. I lost consciousness. When I opened my eyes, I found myself lying and Sandra holding my hands. She had pulled me out of the water on her own. That was a real narrow escape from the death, and if she hadn't been there, I would have drowned.

None of the things that I mentioned above makes us good friends indeed. You cannot get along with someone just for the sake of good personality traits. You need more than that. Remember, a friend in need is a friend indeed.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15504

Read the newspaper articles below and answer the following questions.

1. TURKEY AND CANADA HELP SYRIAN REFUGEES

Due to the ongoing war in Syria, the Syrians have been migrating to a number of different countries. This may seem like a solution to their problems; the war and the migration process, however, may cause long-term damage to refugees’ mental and physical health. To help them, many humanitarian organizations seek funding and resources. Apart from those organizations, some countries such as Canada and Turkey have helped and welcomed them by setting an example to other governments. The two countries have taken on the responsibility to make sure that Syrians are provided with food, running water, and shelter, which is one of the basic human rights.

2. THE JAPANESE TRAIN PICK UP ‘ONE’ PASSENGER EVERY DAY

In Japan, a train visits the Kami-Shirataki station twice a day just to pick up a schoolgirl named Kana. She catches the train at 07.04 a.m. every morning to go to school and returns at 05.08 p.m. in the evening. She is the only person to use the train. The company had planned to shut down the station and the services because it was almost unused in 2012. However, they had found out that a schoolgirl needed to use the train to go to school. After investigating, the company decided to keep it open until Kana graduated from high school in March 2016. The authorities said: “One of the basic human rights is the right to education. We can’t deprive Kana of her rights. We’ll do our best for our country’s future.”

3. POLICE INVESTIGATING 'PUNISH A MUSLIM DAY' LETTERS

In the U.K., the Police are investigating letters calling for a day of Islamophobic violence. The letters are sent by a group of Islam-haters, advertising “Punish a Muslim Day” and promising rewards for attacks such as verbal abuse, pulling the headscarf off of a Muslim woman, etc. A councilor said: “I think it has been sent out by a group to alarm people and to stir up racism.” A Police spokesperson said: “Whatever our differences, we don’t have the right to discriminate. It’s a human rights abuse and we’re on it. We’ll find them as soon as possible.”

4. PRISONER MARRIAGES ARE ON THE INCREASE

If a prisoner marriage is to take place in the US, the wedding cake is scanned with metal detectors and the guests with walk through metal detectors. A few hours after the ceremony, the bride and groom have to say goodbye to each other. However, those constrictions do not seem to diminish the love between couples as prisoner marriages are commonplace around the world and statistics show that they are on the increase. Though some people find this situation difficult to accept, it is quite understandable. Each and every human being has the right to get married and start a family if they want to. That is why many governments pass laws concerning marriages of those in prison.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15512

DISABLED PEOPLE HAVE BARRIERS                                   

In underdeveloped countries, people with disabilities, unfortunately, face discrimination and barriers that restrict them from participating in society on an equal basis with others every day. The difficulties and barriers they usually face in the society are transportation, participating in sport and cultural activities, education, employment, choosing medical treatment, communication and social relationship, getting married, loss of independence and self-esteem. 

A great number of people with disabilities in underdeveloped countries often live marginalized and in extreme poverty due to the lack of accessing work places. Even though they have the same qualifications and skills with healthy people, they have been paid less on the ground that most employers are of the opinion that people with disabilities have lower productivity.

Many public buses, trams, subways, ferries and shuttles have no wheelchair lifts, or the existing ones are not working properly. In particular, people with visual disabilities usually have difficulties in finding bus stops because of the lack of guiding tracts on their ways. Furthermore; audible announcement systems for people with aural disabilities are not available in many public transports.

Researches suggest most disabled people have never received any education, or most of them have had to leave school since the inadequacy of special facilities such as computer aids for the visually disabled are not available, which makes disabled people have less opportunity in receiving education.

Although the equal protection of human rights have been guaranteed by some human rights treaties, and grounded in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, there is still a protection gap in the law of most countries that make disabled people still face barriers. Nevertheless, it can be said that there has been globally awareness of what the disability is and what the needs of them are to close the protection gap and ensure that persons with disabilities should have the same standards of equality, rights and dignity as everyone else. Therefore, not only should the governments do their best to meet the needs of disabled people, but also we all should do our best to remove all the obstacles that restrict disabled people from participating in society.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15504

Read the newspaper articles below and answer the following questions.

1. TURKEY AND CANADA HELP SYRIAN REFUGEES

Due to the ongoing war in Syria, the Syrians have been migrating to a number of different countries. This may seem like a solution to their problems; the war and the migration process, however, may cause long-term damage to refugees’ mental and physical health. To help them, many humanitarian organizations seek funding and resources. Apart from those organizations, some countries such as Canada and Turkey have helped and welcomed them by setting an example to other governments. The two countries have taken on the responsibility to make sure that Syrians are provided with food, running water, and shelter, which is one of the basic human rights.

2. THE JAPANESE TRAIN PICK UP ‘ONE’ PASSENGER EVERY DAY

In Japan, a train visits the Kami-Shirataki station twice a day just to pick up a schoolgirl named Kana. She catches the train at 07.04 a.m. every morning to go to school and returns at 05.08 p.m. in the evening. She is the only person to use the train. The company had planned to shut down the station and the services because it was almost unused in 2012. However, they had found out that a schoolgirl needed to use the train to go to school. After investigating, the company decided to keep it open until Kana graduated from high school in March 2016. The authorities said: “One of the basic human rights is the right to education. We can’t deprive Kana of her rights. We’ll do our best for our country’s future.”

3. POLICE INVESTIGATING 'PUNISH A MUSLIM DAY' LETTERS

In the U.K., the Police are investigating letters calling for a day of Islamophobic violence. The letters are sent by a group of Islam-haters, advertising “Punish a Muslim Day” and promising rewards for attacks such as verbal abuse, pulling the headscarf off of a Muslim woman, etc. A councilor said: “I think it has been sent out by a group to alarm people and to stir up racism.” A Police spokesperson said: “Whatever our differences, we don’t have the right to discriminate. It’s a human rights abuse and we’re on it. We’ll find them as soon as possible.”

4. PRISONER MARRIAGES ARE ON THE INCREASE

If a prisoner marriage is to take place in the US, the wedding cake is scanned with metal detectors and the guests with walk through metal detectors. A few hours after the ceremony, the bride and groom have to say goodbye to each other. However, those constrictions do not seem to diminish the love between couples as prisoner marriages are commonplace around the world and statistics show that they are on the increase. Though some people find this situation difficult to accept, it is quite understandable. Each and every human being has the right to get married and start a family if they want to. That is why many governments pass laws concerning marriages of those in prison.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

There has been a controversy going on between generations since the beginning of human history. Many parents who have been actively involved in their children's early years stand aside the moment their children become teenagers. However, studies clearly show that it's still important for parents to be involved when the children are teenagers. Good parenting continues to help teenagers develop in healthy ways, stay out of trouble and do well in school. According to experts, parents shouldn't fluctuate when they wish to praise their teenage children or to show them physical affection.

B)  they had better show some respect to their children's private lives
C)  they need to be more careful towards their children as youngsters are fragile 
D)  they should take part in their children's school life regardless of any objections
E)  nobody should intervene with teenagers' school lives 
A B C D E

questionText: Answer the following question according to the paragraph. Anorexia is an attempt to control your life and emotions. Your self-esteem depends on how much you weigh and how thin you are (you feel fat despite being underweight). Becoming thin is more important than being healthy. Obsession with calories, fat grams and nutrition (you always measure and weigh portions), pretending to eat or lying about eating (you always make excuses not to have meals) obsessively thinking about food (you cook for others and make meal plans although you eat very little), having very strange food rituals, (you chew and spit it out) obsession about how you look in the mirror and what you can and cannot do, are significant features of an anorexic. Which of the following is not true according to the paragraph? A) an anorexic person prepares the meal not for oneself but for others B) all anorexic patients tend to go beyond their diets C) anyone can become anorexic due to their eating habits D) anorexia is simply the obsession about calories E) anorexic person always measures the calories and fat grams A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15504

Read the newspaper articles below and answer the following questions.

1. TURKEY AND CANADA HELP SYRIAN REFUGEES

Due to the ongoing war in Syria, the Syrians have been migrating to a number of different countries. This may seem like a solution to their problems; the war and the migration process, however, may cause long-term damage to refugees’ mental and physical health. To help them, many humanitarian organizations seek funding and resources. Apart from those organizations, some countries such as Canada and Turkey have helped and welcomed them by setting an example to other governments. The two countries have taken on the responsibility to make sure that Syrians are provided with food, running water, and shelter, which is one of the basic human rights.

2. THE JAPANESE TRAIN PICK UP ‘ONE’ PASSENGER EVERY DAY

In Japan, a train visits the Kami-Shirataki station twice a day just to pick up a schoolgirl named Kana. She catches the train at 07.04 a.m. every morning to go to school and returns at 05.08 p.m. in the evening. She is the only person to use the train. The company had planned to shut down the station and the services because it was almost unused in 2012. However, they had found out that a schoolgirl needed to use the train to go to school. After investigating, the company decided to keep it open until Kana graduated from high school in March 2016. The authorities said: “One of the basic human rights is the right to education. We can’t deprive Kana of her rights. We’ll do our best for our country’s future.”

3. POLICE INVESTIGATING 'PUNISH A MUSLIM DAY' LETTERS

In the U.K., the Police are investigating letters calling for a day of Islamophobic violence. The letters are sent by a group of Islam-haters, advertising “Punish a Muslim Day” and promising rewards for attacks such as verbal abuse, pulling the headscarf off of a Muslim woman, etc. A councilor said: “I think it has been sent out by a group to alarm people and to stir up racism.” A Police spokesperson said: “Whatever our differences, we don’t have the right to discriminate. It’s a human rights abuse and we’re on it. We’ll find them as soon as possible.”

4. PRISONER MARRIAGES ARE ON THE INCREASE

If a prisoner marriage is to take place in the US, the wedding cake is scanned with metal detectors and the guests with walk through metal detectors. A few hours after the ceremony, the bride and groom have to say goodbye to each other. However, those constrictions do not seem to diminish the love between couples as prisoner marriages are commonplace around the world and statistics show that they are on the increase. Though some people find this situation difficult to accept, it is quite understandable. Each and every human being has the right to get married and start a family if they want to. That is why many governments pass laws concerning marriages of those in prison.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

There are various types of cyber threats. Let’s take phishing for the first one. It involves tricking a computer user into performing some risky action that undermines all their previous security precautions. Secondly, we can talk about keylogging. You might be sent an innocuous e-mail, even one that looks like as it has come from an organization or individual you trust. These e-mails contain links or attachments that, when clicked on, cause malicious code to be downloaded. It could be designed to sit quietly on your computer and steal passwords or banking logins. Thirdly, ransoming can be seen as another type. You might receive an e-mail that actually locks your machine down and demand a ransom payment before returning access to you. And this list can be extended.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15556

Choosing Your Mood

Have you ever been in a bad mood that you just can't get rid of? Or you had a lot of work but realize that you're not in the right mood to do it? Remember that we can influence and change moods.

Choosing the right mood can help you take control of things no matter what situation you're in.

Be clear on what you really want and need to do. For instance, you could desire to do your work as fast and well as possible so you can go to a party later. A classmate is better than a chatty friend. Music is one of the most powerful influences on mood because it's all about communicating and inspiring emotion. Create playlists for the moods that are the most helpful and positive for your life. Move your body into the right mood. For studying, try exercises that help you focus on your physical posture. For energy, try something that increases your heart rate up. To prepare for sleep, try to take a deep breath, stretch gently, or other soothing activities. Self-talk is also a way of using thoughts to influence your mood.

To get out of a mood that's unpleasant or unhelpful, think "U for U-turn." You might also try these mood changers:

1. Undo. Do something to break the train of thought that keeps your old mood going. Distract yourself with a game or simply focus on what's going on outside your window for a few minutes. Distractions are like rebooting your mind — they create a space between moods.

2. Unstick. Change your body posture. If you're sitting, stand up. Do some jumping jacks. Stretch. Walk around the room. Moving your body changes your mindset and mood.

3. Unwind. Sit quietly, breathe gently, and focus on each breath. To keep your mind from wandering back to a mood you're trying to change, every time you take a breath, say to yourself: "I'm breathing in" and "I'm breathing out." Focus on feeling calm.

You've probably chosen your mood before without even realizing it — many times people choose a mood naturally without thinking about it. But practicing ways to choose your mood intentionally can help you get good at it.

 

So next time you feel a strong mood, stop and name it. Ask yourself if it's the ideal mood for what you're trying to accomplish. Sometimes, even the happiest of moods might not be right for a particular situation.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

Mr. Timmons: Good afternoon everyone.

Students: Good afternoon, sir.

Mr. Timmons: It seems to me that most of you are upset.

Peter: We are, sir. We have just had a physics exam and most of us did badly.

Mr. Timmons: We do not expect you to do well in all exams, Peter. These things happen. I suggest you …………….. about it and focus on the next exam.

Linda: If we had a choice now, we wouldn’t sit for exams.

Mr. Timmons: That’s also what we teachers would do if we had the chance, Linda. Anyway, we’d rather ……………. something to change the negative mood here. Any suggestions?

Emma: Let’s ………….. the classroom and let some fresh air in. It’s really stuffy in here.

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15566

How important are the feelings in our lives?

Have you ever thought about the way you live your life? Are you more of a rational or emotional person? Most people assume that being rational is better than being emotional in many cases and they try to live accordingly. No matter how rational you are or you try to be, the feelings are in the centre of our lives.

Did you know that there are more than 400 words assigned to sentiments and emotions in the English language or that a human can make over 10.000 facial expressions to express a wide variety of emotions? Is it possible to live without these words and ignore the physical realities?

Emotions are inescapable. Have you ever texted or talked to any of your friends pretending to be ill and watched yourself? According to studies, even if people adjust their facial expressions to reflect an emotion, they actually begin to feel that emotion. For instance, if you pretend to be disgusted or ill, you will really feel disgusted or ill.

People usually tend to have problems with their emotions. According to studies, ten out of hundred people don’t even know how they feel that is a severe dysfunction called alexithymia. Or some other people prefer to hide their feelings like an eccedentesiast, a term for the people who hide pain or sadness behind their smile which is known to be the most deceptive one of all facial expressions. It is also said that there are about 18 different smiles and only one of them, which is called as Duchenne smile, reflects a genuine happiness.

Although you are the coolest person inborn who lives a stable life and usually feels neutral or a person who hides his/her feelings, you are affected by the society and language in which you live your life. All in all, it is more rational to accept the reality and cope with emotionality.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

Although many young people use computers in a creative way, surveys suggest that they may experience psychological problems such as loneliness, isolation and depression. The main reason for these problems is the time allocated to computers. Psychologists advise parents to limit the time spent on the Net and to devote more time to physical activities and imaginative plays. They also say that family gatherings and short holidays without computers may be a good way to socialize their children. There are also advice centres whose aim is to inform parents about using the computer in a balanced way.

According to the passage in order to make their children more sociable, parents ...... .

A) shouldn't let their children spend time
B) should lead their life without computer
C) should organise family activities to spend more time with their children
D) should go online, too
E) should tell their children to use computers creatively
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15550

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

Patch Adams is best known for his work as a medical doctor and a clown, but he is also a social activist who has devoted over 40 years of his life to changing America's healthcare system. He believes that laughter, joy and creativity are an integral part of the healing process and, with the help of friends, he founded the Gesundheit Institute in 1971 in order to address all the problems of health care in one model. The Gesundheit Institute, a non-profit healthcare organization, is a project in holistic medical care based on the belief that one cannot separate the health of the individual from the health of the family, the community, the society, and the world. Their mission is to reframe and reclaim the concept of 'hospital'.

According to Adams, ...... .

A) laughter, joy and creativity are indivisible parts for the recovery period
B) Gesundheit Institute deals with only some problems of health care
C) today's hospitals are insufficient to heal the patients
D) it is not necessary to change America's healthcare system
E) the Institute should be a profit-oriented healthcare system
A B C D E

E) Change your psychology to feel happier!

questionText: Answer the question according to the paragraph below. Your mood will change if you use your body in a different way. For example, if you want to feel better, try to smile for some time.  If you want to feel confident, stand up and walk slowly and lift your head up and your back straight. You’ll feel more confident. If you feel down, just look up! You will see the sky, and it will put you in a good mood. It is even better to combine everything at once. What is the best title for the paragraph? A) Work out to feel happier! B) Change your physiology to feel better! C) Be more confident for success! D) Feel happier than you were yesterday! E) Change your psychology to feel happier! A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15566

How important are the feelings in our lives?

Have you ever thought about the way you live your life? Are you more of a rational or emotional person? Most people assume that being rational is better than being emotional in many cases and they try to live accordingly. No matter how rational you are or you try to be, the feelings are in the centre of our lives.

Did you know that there are more than 400 words assigned to sentiments and emotions in the English language or that a human can make over 10.000 facial expressions to express a wide variety of emotions? Is it possible to live without these words and ignore the physical realities?

Emotions are inescapable. Have you ever texted or talked to any of your friends pretending to be ill and watched yourself? According to studies, even if people adjust their facial expressions to reflect an emotion, they actually begin to feel that emotion. For instance, if you pretend to be disgusted or ill, you will really feel disgusted or ill.

People usually tend to have problems with their emotions. According to studies, ten out of hundred people don’t even know how they feel that is a severe dysfunction called alexithymia. Or some other people prefer to hide their feelings like an eccedentesiast, a term for the people who hide pain or sadness behind their smile which is known to be the most deceptive one of all facial expressions. It is also said that there are about 18 different smiles and only one of them, which is called as Duchenne smile, reflects a genuine happiness.

Although you are the coolest person inborn who lives a stable life and usually feels neutral or a person who hides his/her feelings, you are affected by the society and language in which you live your life. All in all, it is more rational to accept the reality and cope with emotionality.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15580

Read the text and answer the following questions.

SFE Charity Organization claims that every year, an increasing number of old people are left alone by their children or grandchildren in Europe. As they have health problems, more than half of them cannot work and earn money for living. Only 30 percent of them have retirement salary, but it doesn’t afford all their expenses. SFE knows that safe, proper and affordable shelter plays a definitely vital role in helping old people. The organization aims to create a social, caring and loving atmosphere for elders. They constructed a Care Center building in 2005, equipped with lots of facilities such as personal rooms with bathrooms, Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Center, infirmary and activity halls. They also have an agreement with the nearest pre-school so that kids come and spend time with old people twice a month.

To participate in the organization, you should pay 20 Euros of membership fee per year, take part in at least three campaigns and visit the nearest SFE office once a month. Otherwise, your membership will be cancelled because no passive membership is accepted.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15586

FAVOR FOR ANGELS

LÖSEV is a non-profit organization, which aims to provide educational, emotional, financial support and health services for children who have leukemia or chronic blood disorders. It also aims to raise awareness and provide training at an international level as well as establishing and operating research institutions.

In Turkey, 1200-1500 children are diagnosed with new cases of leukemia every year. Families with low income or limited financial resources have difficulty in choosing to support their healthy child, or the one who has leukemia. LÖSEV provides financial support for these families. Besides economic matters, families also face with psychological problems during the treatment of their children. They need to migrate to big cities where they can get necessary medical resources and adaptation to city life forces them as well as the treatment procedure.

On 24 September 2000, LÖSEV opened LOSANTE, which is the first and only hospital for leukemic children in Turkey. The hospital has been providing medical treatment to thousands of children and psychological support to their families since that date.

On the other hand, in order to get positive results from the treatment, the children should be in sterile environments. However, as a result of this period, children with leukemia cannot go to school regularly and their education is interrupted. To ensure that children with leukemia reach the same levels of education with their peers, LÖSEV founded the SCHOOL FOR CHILDREN WITH LEUKEMIA. The school provides Art, Music, English, Computer Sciences, Drama and Literature lessons.

With the help of the volunteers, LÖSEV also organizes educational activities and campaigns to ask for donation to the charity. If you want to do a favor for these little angels and their families, you can participate in the organization or take part in charity activities.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

On 24 September 2000, LÖSEV opened LOSANTE, which is the first and only hospital for leukemic children in Turkey. The hospital has been providing medical treatment to thousands of children and psychological support to their families since that date.

On the other hand, in order to get positive results from the treatment, the children should be in sterile environments. However, as a result of this period, children with leukemia cannot go to school regularly and their education is interrupted. To ensure that children with leukemia reach the same levels of education with their peers, LÖSEV founded the SCHOOL FOR CHILDREN WITH LEUKEMIA. The school provides Art, Music, English, Computer Sciences, Drama and Literature lessons.

With the help of the volunteers, LÖSEV also organizes educational activities and campaigns to ask for donation to the charity. If you want to do a favor for these little angels and their families, you can participate in the organization or take part in charity activities.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E
questionText: FAVOR FOR ANGELS LÖSEV is a non-profit organization, which aims to provide educational, emotional, financial support and health services for children who have leukemia or chronic blood disorders. It also aims to raise awareness and provide training at an international level as well as establishing and operating research institutions. In Turkey, 1200-1500 children are diagnosed with new cases of leukemia every year. Families with low income or limited financial resources have difficulty in choosing to support their healthy child, or the one who has leukemia. LÖSEV provides financial support for these families. Besides economic matters, families also face with psychological problems during the treatment of their children. They need to migrate to big cities where they can get necessary medical resources and adaptation to city life forces them as well as the treatment procedure. On 24 September 2000, LÖSEV opened LOSANTE , which is the first and only hospital for leukemic children in Turkey. The hospital has been providing medical treatment to thousands of children and psychological support to their families since that date. On the other hand, in order to get positive results from the treatment, the children should be in sterile environments. However, as a result of this period, children with leukemia cannot go to school regularly and their education is interrupted. To ensure that children with leukemia reach the same levels of education with their peers, LÖSEV founded the SCHOOL FOR CHILDREN WITH LEUKEMIA . The school provides Art, Music, English, Computer Sciences, Drama and Literature lessons. With the help of the volunteers, LÖSEV also organizes educational activities and campaigns to ask for donation to the charity. If you want to do a favor for these little angels and their families, you can participate in the organization or take part in charity activities. A) - B) - C) - D) - E) - A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15592

Deliverance Charity Organization

Deliverance Charity Organization is a foundation established by volunteers who would like to help people make their lives easier in 2001. Their first charity building was constructed in London but later on, they became widespread all around the world and now they have an office almost in every European country. Today, they have approximately 20 million members throughout the world. The benefits that safe and affordable shelter can have on families and communities who partner with this organization can be long- lasting and life- changing. Day by day, increasing number of families find themselves in a battle to keep a decent roof over their heads. While these families are suffering from unpredictable rent increases, overpopulated conditions, or lack of access to land and affordable financing, they live with an endless responsibility of uncertainty, stress and anxiety.

Deliverance Charity Organization knows that safe, proper and affordable shelter plays a definitely vital role in helping families to create a new cycle filled with possibilities and progress. Low- cost home ownership sets free families and forwards the skills and confidence they need to invest in themselves and their communities. To join this organization, you should pay 20 dollars of membership fee per year and join at least three organizations of the association in a year. Otherwise, your membership will be canceled because no passive membership is allowed.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

The history of paper began nearly five thousand years ago in Ancient Egypt, where papyrus was used to write on. Firstly, the Sumerians had used clay tablets, which were not light and solid. Ts'ai Lun is credited for creating the first sheet of paper by mixing plant fibres with old rags and leaving the mixture to dry. Before the invention of paper, documents in China had been written on bone tablets or bamboo scrolls. Silk was used too, yet it was expensive. Paper spread slowly out of China to the Middle East; however, it didn't reach Europe until a thousand years later. People were still using animal skins to make a thin material called parchment. Wood replaced plant fibres in papermaking to make the process cheaper.

Which of the following is the best title for the paragraph?

A) Sumerians and the Paper
B) Paper Making Industry in China
C) Clay Tablets and Animal Skins
D) History of Wood and Fibres
E) Papermaking Over the Centuries
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15620

RENOWNED PHYSICIST STEPHEN HAWKING DIED

Stephen Hawking, one of science’s most well-known figures, died on March 14, at the age of 76. He had many contributions to science in spite of his limited mobility and ability to communicate. His life story was full of faith, determination and struggle.

Born in 1942 in Oxford, Stephen Hawking was not a bright student in primary school. His was nicknamed Einstein, but his marks weren’t very good at all. In spite of this, he later got a scholarship to Oxford University as he scored 100% on physics exam. He stated that he worked only one hour a day at university and spent more time in the rowing team. In order to do a PhD in cosmology, he then went to Cambridge University.

Soon after he started his career in Cambridge, Hawking went to see a doctor as he started falling over. It was understood that he had developed a motor neurone disease, and, at the age of  21, the doctors said he had only two years left. Even though he proved them wrong, he started to lose some of his physical abilities. In the coming years, he lost the ability to walk and speak totally. The illness did not stop him and he never gave up. He used movements of his cheek for writing on his computer keyboard and put the words through using a speech synthesiser.

In his career, he had a lot of honorary degrees and published many books and scientific papers. The most famous theory of him was about black holes and he had also a model of the universe without space or time limits. His book , A Brief History of Time, became a best-seller. He also wrote a children’s book with his daughter, George’s Secret Key to the Universe. He once said ironically: “Look up at the stars, not down at your feet.” His biggest dream was to go to space.

Even before his death, he published an important paper related to the existence of other universes.  Two weeks before his death, he published his final theory in a paper called "A Smooth Exit from Eternal Inflation". He explained two very important ideas. Carlos Frenk, a professor of cosmology, said: "These ideas offer the breathtaking prospect of finding evidence for the existence of other universes." He went on his contributions to science even after his death. 

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15623

It was a warm day with plenty of sunshine in early Spring when we set off for the capital excitedly to watch a Championships League match. As we were driving on the steep slopes on our route, the warm weather, together with the sunshine, disappeared and suddenly it started to hail. The ice cubes were as big as cubes of sugar. We didn’t know what to do. It was getting worse and worse. We could hardly see the road. We took a deep breath when we saw a stopover on the right and took shelter in there. Before the hail started, we had already decided to have lunch at a restaurant nearby. However, while we were having lunch and expecting the hail to die down, it turned into snow. At first, we thought it wouldn’t last for a long time and enjoyed our drinks. Meanwhile, it got even heavier and two hours later, all the roads were completely covered with snow. Each snow flake caused us to lose our hopes of watching the match. We tried to keep each other moralized and hopeful despite the possibility of staying there overnight. Fortunately, it stopped and the sun appeared once more in the sky as soon as the snow stopped. Soon after this, it melted and we hit the road again. The fear was replaced by smiles on our faces. After we had driven for 2 more hours, finally, we arrived in Madrid and started to count down for the Championships League match that night. We strolled the city for a short time and then went into the stadium. We got involved in the exciting atmosphere of the stadium and when the match started, we had forgotten about all the difficulties on the road.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 52995

Alternative energy is defined as “energy fuelled in ways that do not use up the Earth's natural resources, otherwise harm the environment, especially by avoiding use of fossil fuels or nuclear power”. Environmental problems, some of which are global warming, climate change, pollution, deforestation or overpopulation, are mostly caused by carbon emission. Carbon is everywhere; in the air we breathe, in the food we eat and in the products we use. Household waste is also a major issue we should deal with. Putting things in garbage bags seperately or avoiding using plastic shopping bags may be of help. Another factor that should be minimized is deforestation since it may trigger floods or soil erosion. People believe that alternative energy forms are the most effective solutions to those problems as long as we can raise awareness.

Choose the option that is not true according to the paragraph.

A) Climate change and pollution are environmental problems.
B) Carbon emission is the reason behind most of the environmental problems.
C) Alternative energy is a solution to environmental problems.
D) Sorting out the garbage is essential for household waste collection.
E) There is no need to raise awareness about alternative energy sources.
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15654

Human activities are rapidly changing the climate and cause major environmental problems. According to the report by Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change, human activities over the past 50 years have damaged the environment seriously and these activities are going to affect all living things and the Earth itself severely. Well, is it too late for us to do something? Can't we help to change the course of events?

            Most people believe that inclining to alternative, renewable or clean energy forms have been considered to be the number one solution to environmental problems. However, this is a highly debatable matter as there are many other things to be done primarily. Before we decide what must be done, we need to be aware of the main reasons for environmental issues. For instance, human-produced carbon dioxide emissions lead to any form of pollution such as land, air and water pollution. Besides, global climate change, deforestation, overpopulation and  some forms of household waste as other major issues to be dealt with. Fortunately, we haven't passed the point of no return. There is still time to start changing our ways and save the nature.

            An average household produces tons of garbage each year and it is a vain effort to send these masses to other countries or seek for economical ways of disposal as the only solution. They may work out well but trying to consumpt more wisely make a much better contribution. Although it seems very simple,  using recycling bins to manage waste, avoiding using plastic shopping bags, stopping buying new stuff just for a change may help much more than it is thought. Deforestation is another factor which can be kept at certain levels or minimized. Due to increasing human population, there is a drastic rise in necessity for food, water and sheltering and in order to create new areas for increasing population to construct homes, roads, factories and agriculture; deforestation occurs. Therefore, it causes flooding, soil erosion, droughts, global warming, extinction of species, loss of habitat and some other issues. We can minimize deforestation by means of determining residential areas that do not require deforestation, constructing underground transportation systems, making public aware of family planning.

            Protecting the environment is our mutual responsibility, so we must live in a way that musn't hurt the Earth and its residents.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15660

If you are one of those who keep up with the latest developments in science, technology, space travel or online payment, you are likely to be familiar with the name Elon Musk. Born in South Africa, now residing in Los Angeles, Musk made an early name for himself by creating an online payment service. He made headlines in May 2012 when one of his companies launched a rocket that would carry the first commercial vehicle to the International Space Station. He, then, created another company to make affordable solar products to secure lower fixed energy rates for years to come and became a leader of shaping the future technology. He is also the co-founder, CEO and product architect of a company which is working on affordable mass market electric cars as well as battery products.

With his team, he has recently introduced a new semi-truck which boasts 500 miles of range. It can extend to 1 million miles with an added battery. He is proud of this product which is the fastest car ever made with its 0 to 60 time of 1.9 seconds. "By doing, I am planning to give a hard smack-down to gasoline cars" he says and adds "Driving a gasoline sports car is going to feel like a steam engine". He has founded Musk Foundation which is dedicated to space exploration and the discovery of renewable and clean energy sources. He is the one to be appreciated for all his efforts to broaden the vision of humanity to protect Mother Earth.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15672

The pollution in the air and the water caused by the burning of coal and natural gas is known to be linked with a number of diseases. Neurological damage, breathing problems, cancer, heart attacks, and premature deaths are some of these diseases. In order to minimize these negative health impacts, we should use clean energy technologies, also known as renewables, which don’t cause pollution. Biomass and geothermal systems give off some air pollutants. However, the total amount of air emissions is much lower in general when compared to the power plants fired with coal and natural gas. Solar and wind systems, on the other hand, are able to produce electricity with no emissions causing air pollution.

According to a study on the health benefits of renewables, wind and solar power have prevented the premature deaths of up to 12,700 people only in the USA since the year 2007. By reducing the need for producing electricity through fossil fuels, wind and solar power systems provide air quality. These clean technologies have led to major cuts in carbon emissions and toxic air pollutants, thereby decreasing the incidence of lung cancer and other breathing problems.

Fossil fuels can have an ill effect on water resources as the process of natural gas drilling and coal mining can cause water pollution. When it comes to thermal power plants, they withdraw and consume water for cooling. In contrast, solar and wind energy do not require water to operate and they don’t pollute water resources. A reduction in water use makes more resources available for farming and drinking water.

If we put it in a nutshell, choosing to use renewable energy helps us decrease pollution levels and life-threatening illnesses and we can save many lives. It is our ultimate responsibility towards our loved ones and the coming generations.

Read the text above and answer the following questions.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15678

Alternative Energy Sources

 The Earth’s atmosphere contains around 0.04 percent of carbon dioxide. Coal and oil are the fossil fuels which are used to generate electricity and heat. They release carbon dioxide to the atmosphere when they burn. The use of fossil fuels increases the level of carbon dioxide and this increased level of carbon dioxide causes “Global Warming.“

 A solution for global warming and pollution is to replace technologies with alternatives that have comparable or better performance, but do not emit carbon dioxide. This is called as “Alternate Energy“.

Alternative energy sources are widely available and environment friendly. It can also be called as renewable energy. It is a form of energy derived from a natural source, such as the sun and wind. Let‘s have a look at some of the most common ones that are available.

Wind Energy:

This type of energy source has been in use for a very long time. It is one of the cleanest and most sustainable ways to generate electricity. Wind power produces no toxic emissions and no pollution. Since it is a renewable source of energy, we will never run out of it. But if wind speed decreases, the turbine will not work efficiently to generate enough electricity.

Solar Energy:

It is the first energy source in the world. The solar energy is mostly used in generating light and heat. However, it can only be effective in warm regions which can receive good sunlight. The advantages of solar energy are much more than its disadvantages. For instance, solar energy does not create any pollution and it is a renewable source of energy. As long as the Sun exists, we will be using its power.

Geothermal Energy:

Geothermal energy is continuously produced in the rock and fluids beneath Earth‘s crust. These underground reservoirs of steam and hot water are used to generate heat and electricity. Geothermal energy produces no pollution and it is regarded as a renewable source of energy since Earth will continue to produce heat as long as it exists. Due to the improper drillings, hazardous minerals and gases for mankind may be released. The biggest challenge in supplying the geothermal energy is about the regions which are prone to earthquakes and volcanoes.

 

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 52999

Choose the best option for the situation given below.

     You work for a big company. Your team has just started an important project. You have a new colleague and your boss thinks that he will be very successful in this job. However, you don’t feel like he is doing well. He spends more time on chatting with the colleagues, talking on the phone or doing shopping online. So, you need to complain about the new colleague to the boss:

A) There appears to be a problem with the project. May you help us?
B) Don’t get me wrong but I’m fed up with this mess. Please, help me!
C) I’m not happy with his haircut. How can we fix it?
D) I’m sorry but I’d like to make a complaint. The new colleague doesn’t chat with me.
E) I’m sorry to have to say this, but I’m really disappointed about our new colleague’s performance about the project
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 53002

Which of the following is the correct order of the sentences to make a meaningful complaint letter?

(I) I look forward to hearing from you.

(II) I trust that the chimneys will be filtered urgently or the thermal power plant will be moved to somewhere out of the city completely.

(III) Dear Sir or Madam, 

(IV) Yours faithfully,

            Mike Andrew ROSS

(V) I’m a resident of Yatağan, in Muğla. I’m writing to address a serious environmental problem in our neighbourhood.

(VI) I have been living here for five years and I have allergic asthma due to the thermal power plant that has been operating here since 1982. The air is so polluted that sometimes we can’t even breathe. Most of the residents are farmers and also busy with stockfarming. They have suffered from not only air pollution but also their agricultural products. 

(VII) I’m sure that you will do your best to solve this problem as this is a serious threat to all people and the environment.

A) V- II- VII- I- III- VI- IV 
B)  I- II- III- IV- V- VI- VII
C) III- VI- I- V- IV- II- VII
D) III- V- VI- II- VII- I- IV
E) VII- VI- V- IV- III- II- I
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 53006

Answer the following question according to the letter below.

Dear Sir or Madam, 

I’m a resident of Yatağan, in Muğla. I’m writing to address a serious environmental problem in our neighbourhood. I have been living here for five years and I have allergic asthma due to the thermal power plant that has been operating here since 1982. The air is so polluted that sometimes we can’t even breathe. Most of the residents are farmers and also busy with stock farming. Not only have they suffered from air pollution but also their agricultural products.  I trust that the chimneys will be filtered urgently or the thermal power plant will be moved to somewhere out of the city completely. I’m sure that you will do your best to solve this problem as this is a serious threat to all people and the environment.

I look forward to hearing from you.

Yours faithfully,

            Mike Andrew ROSS

What is the complaint letter about?

 

 

A) noise pollution 
B) household waste
C) air pollution
D) traffic jam
E) deforestation
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15654

Human activities are rapidly changing the climate and cause major environmental problems. According to the report by Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change, human activities over the past 50 years have damaged the environment seriously and these activities are going to affect all living things and the Earth itself severely. Well, is it too late for us to do something? Can't we help to change the course of events?

            Most people believe that inclining to alternative, renewable or clean energy forms have been considered to be the number one solution to environmental problems. However, this is a highly debatable matter as there are many other things to be done primarily. Before we decide what must be done, we need to be aware of the main reasons for environmental issues. For instance, human-produced carbon dioxide emissions lead to any form of pollution such as land, air and water pollution. Besides, global climate change, deforestation, overpopulation and  some forms of household waste as other major issues to be dealt with. Fortunately, we haven't passed the point of no return. There is still time to start changing our ways and save the nature.

            An average household produces tons of garbage each year and it is a vain effort to send these masses to other countries or seek for economical ways of disposal as the only solution. They may work out well but trying to consumpt more wisely make a much better contribution. Although it seems very simple,  using recycling bins to manage waste, avoiding using plastic shopping bags, stopping buying new stuff just for a change may help much more than it is thought. Deforestation is another factor which can be kept at certain levels or minimized. Due to increasing human population, there is a drastic rise in necessity for food, water and sheltering and in order to create new areas for increasing population to construct homes, roads, factories and agriculture; deforestation occurs. Therefore, it causes flooding, soil erosion, droughts, global warming, extinction of species, loss of habitat and some other issues. We can minimize deforestation by means of determining residential areas that do not require deforestation, constructing underground transportation systems, making public aware of family planning.

            Protecting the environment is our mutual responsibility, so we must live in a way that musn't hurt the Earth and its residents.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15660

If you are one of those who keep up with the latest developments in science, technology, space travel or online payment, you are likely to be familiar with the name Elon Musk. Born in South Africa, now residing in Los Angeles, Musk made an early name for himself by creating an online payment service. He made headlines in May 2012 when one of his companies launched a rocket that would carry the first commercial vehicle to the International Space Station. He, then, created another company to make affordable solar products to secure lower fixed energy rates for years to come and became a leader of shaping the future technology. He is also the co-founder, CEO and product architect of a company which is working on affordable mass market electric cars as well as battery products.

With his team, he has recently introduced a new semi-truck which boasts 500 miles of range. It can extend to 1 million miles with an added battery. He is proud of this product which is the fastest car ever made with its 0 to 60 time of 1.9 seconds. "By doing, I am planning to give a hard smack-down to gasoline cars" he says and adds "Driving a gasoline sports car is going to feel like a steam engine". He has founded Musk Foundation which is dedicated to space exploration and the discovery of renewable and clean energy sources. He is the one to be appreciated for all his efforts to broaden the vision of humanity to protect Mother Earth.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15672

The pollution in the air and the water caused by the burning of coal and natural gas is known to be linked with a number of diseases. Neurological damage, breathing problems, cancer, heart attacks, and premature deaths are some of these diseases. In order to minimize these negative health impacts, we should use clean energy technologies, also known as renewables, which don’t cause pollution. Biomass and geothermal systems give off some air pollutants. However, the total amount of air emissions is much lower in general when compared to the power plants fired with coal and natural gas. Solar and wind systems, on the other hand, are able to produce electricity with no emissions causing air pollution.

According to a study on the health benefits of renewables, wind and solar power have prevented the premature deaths of up to 12,700 people only in the USA since the year 2007. By reducing the need for producing electricity through fossil fuels, wind and solar power systems provide air quality. These clean technologies have led to major cuts in carbon emissions and toxic air pollutants, thereby decreasing the incidence of lung cancer and other breathing problems.

Fossil fuels can have an ill effect on water resources as the process of natural gas drilling and coal mining can cause water pollution. When it comes to thermal power plants, they withdraw and consume water for cooling. In contrast, solar and wind energy do not require water to operate and they don’t pollute water resources. A reduction in water use makes more resources available for farming and drinking water.

If we put it in a nutshell, choosing to use renewable energy helps us decrease pollution levels and life-threatening illnesses and we can save many lives. It is our ultimate responsibility towards our loved ones and the coming generations.

Read the text above and answer the following questions.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E
