questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15678

Alternative Energy Sources

 The Earth’s atmosphere contains around 0.04 percent of carbon dioxide. Coal and oil are the fossil fuels which are used to generate electricity and heat. They release carbon dioxide to the atmosphere when they burn. The use of fossil fuels increases the level of carbon dioxide and this increased level of carbon dioxide causes “Global Warming.“

 A solution for global warming and pollution is to replace technologies with alternatives that have comparable or better performance, but do not emit carbon dioxide. This is called as “Alternate Energy“.

Alternative energy sources are widely available and environment friendly. It can also be called as renewable energy. It is a form of energy derived from a natural source, such as the sun and wind. Let‘s have a look at some of the most common ones that are available.

Wind Energy:

This type of energy source has been in use for a very long time. It is one of the cleanest and most sustainable ways to generate electricity. Wind power produces no toxic emissions and no pollution. Since it is a renewable source of energy, we will never run out of it. But if wind speed decreases, the turbine will not work efficiently to generate enough electricity.

Solar Energy:

It is the first energy source in the world. The solar energy is mostly used in generating light and heat. However, it can only be effective in warm regions which can receive good sunlight. The advantages of solar energy are much more than its disadvantages. For instance, solar energy does not create any pollution and it is a renewable source of energy. As long as the Sun exists, we will be using its power.

Geothermal Energy:

Geothermal energy is continuously produced in the rock and fluids beneath Earth‘s crust. These underground reservoirs of steam and hot water are used to generate heat and electricity. Geothermal energy produces no pollution and it is regarded as a renewable source of energy since Earth will continue to produce heat as long as it exists. Due to the improper drillings, hazardous minerals and gases for mankind may be released. The biggest challenge in supplying the geothermal energy is about the regions which are prone to earthquakes and volcanoes.

 

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

Which of the following can be said according to the given situation?

Your housemate has been taking important exams for a week and studying until late hours. Yesterday evening, he drank and ate many things but couldn’t put the things away as he rushed off from the house. He wrote you a brief note to get you to do something for him. At the note :

A) If you don’t want to get yourself into trouble, you had better listen to his advice.
B) Could you please help me find the books that I need to study for my exams?
C) Sorry, but I couldn’t have time to clear up this mess. Can you do the dishes, please?
D) Don’t feel offended, but I don’t want to share a house with you anymore.
E) Why haven’t you called and let me know that you won’t be able to cook dinner?
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15706

TECHNOPHOBIA OR TECHNOPHILIA?

Patrick Holloway is a young director, who has set the world on fire with his great films. He has a little chat with our interviewer, Linda, about the electronic devices in his life.

1 Are you for or against technology?

I’m a tech-savvy person. Technology lets me make money and gain time, so I love it. The earliest directors used to make black and white films with the help of an electrically-driven device known as Kinetoscope. Phantoscope, with which motion pictures in color can be produced, came out after that. With Kinetophonograph, they were able to produce motion pictures with sounds. Many decades later, we now use super-duper cameras equipped with the latest technology to shoot a film. When all these things are taken into consideration, it would be madness not to be fond of technology.

2 Which pieces of technology are important to you?

My laptop, my smartphone, my tablet and my digital camera are certainly the most important ones. My laptop helps me work wherever I go whereas I can use my tablet to read e-books while travelling. My smartphone, on the other hand, enables me to maintain contact with producers and actors. My digicam makes getting photos far easier as it saves a great deal of time. I don’t have to get a photographer to develop negative films and have them printed.

3 You have talked about portable gadgets. How about others?

Well, I think the dishwasher and the washing machine are absolute lifesavers. I live alone and don’t like having another person help with the housework, so I try to handle everything on my own. These machines allow me to do other things while they are washing dirty plates, glasses, and clothes. I can spend the time needed to do the laundry and the dishes on working.

4 What kind of technological devices do you think must be developed?

A special camera, with which I can get my films shot while sitting in my living-room, would be really great. I think that means a machine which can take my orders and put them across to the film crew and actors.

5 So, we can say you aren’t a technophobe, can’t we?

Of course! I’m definitely a technophile and I embrace the technology that can help me do things in a better and simpler way.

Read the interview above and answer the following questions.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15717

Robert      Tiffany, I’ve had to deal with a lot of repairs these days. Both at  home and in the office. It’s been tiring.

Tiffany      You are right Robert. I think that’s partly because the gadgets in the office are past their primes. They are a bit old.

Robert      Yeah. They have malfunctions often, and it adds to office expenditures. We ought to get new ones for economy, and comfort.

Tiffany      Perhaps we should adopt smart technologies.

Robert      You hit the nail on the head. There are smart devices for almost any office work, from security to cleaning, from air conditioning to presentations. I’ve read an article about the newest innovations.

Tiffany      Did anything grab your attention?

Robert      Yes, a smart security camera. I'm fond of them. It can identify human beings, recognize their faces and even alert you via your phone.

Tiffany      Come on! It makes no difference to me. The building already has tight security.

Robert      That’s right. Men are more interested in these kinds of things. Security issues, I mean.

Tiffany      I noticed the other day that the sanitary staff are having difficulty with this vacuum cleaner.

Robert      The robot vacuum. We can get one. It’ll ease up everything for them. It cleans better and allows you to control it remotely.

Tiffany      Hooray! Excellent.

Robert      And, one more. That’s revolutionary.

Tiffany      What is that?

Robert      Interactive touch- screen projector. It turns any surface into an interactive touch screen.

Tiffany      Are you serious? You are kidding!

Robert        I am serious Tiffany. The incredible has come true.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15725

HUMAN vs. AI

Artificial intelligence, also known as AI, is a scientific discipline that is concerned with ensuring that machines produce solutions to complex problems like humans. This is usually done by taking the characteristic of human intelligence and applying it to the computer as an algorithm. Today, there are thousands of application areas that have the potential to use artificial intelligence. These areas can be assessed in a wide range of military applications, from autonomic control and target detection, to entertainment, such as computer games and robotic animals. It can also be used in areas where information needs to be processed in a large amount such as customer behaviour and trend detection in banking, healthcare and insurance companies. The AI, which is the subject of many science fiction films as well as the sun, seems to be sure to carry our daily life in very different directions with the development of the researches in the following years. Although the application areas mentioned above are only a very small amount, they have been used for military purposes since the past years, and in the near future, robots will be fighting instead of humans. Artificial intelligence tactics are still used today even in the game world by young people. However, it is very difficult to predict what will happen in the future because it seems that the limit of what can be done in this area can only be imagined.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15706

TECHNOPHOBIA OR TECHNOPHILIA?

Patrick Holloway is a young director, who has set the world on fire with his great films. He has a little chat with our interviewer, Linda, about the electronic devices in his life.

1 Are you for or against technology?

I’m a tech-savvy person. Technology lets me make money and gain time, so I love it. The earliest directors used to make black and white films with the help of an electrically-driven device known as Kinetoscope. Phantoscope, with which motion pictures in color can be produced, came out after that. With Kinetophonograph, they were able to produce motion pictures with sounds. Many decades later, we now use super-duper cameras equipped with the latest technology to shoot a film. When all these things are taken into consideration, it would be madness not to be fond of technology.

2 Which pieces of technology are important to you?

My laptop, my smartphone, my tablet and my digital camera are certainly the most important ones. My laptop helps me work wherever I go whereas I can use my tablet to read e-books while travelling. My smartphone, on the other hand, enables me to maintain contact with producers and actors. My digicam makes getting photos far easier as it saves a great deal of time. I don’t have to get a photographer to develop negative films and have them printed.

3 You have talked about portable gadgets. How about others?

Well, I think the dishwasher and the washing machine are absolute lifesavers. I live alone and don’t like having another person help with the housework, so I try to handle everything on my own. These machines allow me to do other things while they are washing dirty plates, glasses, and clothes. I can spend the time needed to do the laundry and the dishes on working.

4 What kind of technological devices do you think must be developed?

A special camera, with which I can get my films shot while sitting in my living-room, would be really great. I think that means a machine which can take my orders and put them across to the film crew and actors.

5 So, we can say you aren’t a technophobe, can’t we?

Of course! I’m definitely a technophile and I embrace the technology that can help me do things in a better and simpler way.

Read the interview above and answer the following questions.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15725

HUMAN vs. AI

Artificial intelligence, also known as AI, is a scientific discipline that is concerned with ensuring that machines produce solutions to complex problems like humans. This is usually done by taking the characteristic of human intelligence and applying it to the computer as an algorithm. Today, there are thousands of application areas that have the potential to use artificial intelligence. These areas can be assessed in a wide range of military applications, from autonomic control and target detection, to entertainment, such as computer games and robotic animals. It can also be used in areas where information needs to be processed in a large amount such as customer behaviour and trend detection in banking, healthcare and insurance companies. The AI, which is the subject of many science fiction films as well as the sun, seems to be sure to carry our daily life in very different directions with the development of the researches in the following years. Although the application areas mentioned above are only a very small amount, they have been used for military purposes since the past years, and in the near future, robots will be fighting instead of humans. Artificial intelligence tactics are still used today even in the game world by young people. However, it is very difficult to predict what will happen in the future because it seems that the limit of what can be done in this area can only be imagined.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

Mary Miller

C) You and your husband went to the hospital to visit one of your neighbours who had had a surgery lately. You are looking for the room and speaking to your husband in a low voice.
D) Your grandfather visits you and you are just back from school. You feel tired and you want to have a rest and listen to music. You go directly to your room and don’t say hi to him.

A B C D E

Judy

E) -

questionText: 1 I’m truly sorry and very embarrased about forgetting to mention you that  the meeting we  were going to do yesterday had been cancelled. I was very busy all day. So, only after two hours after the meeting time, I remembered that I had overlooked calling you about the situation. It must have been realy annoying for you to be ignored.  If  only I had remembered to check my agenda. I hope, you will accept my sincere apology and won’t let this fault of mine to affect our friendship. Alan Carter 2 Our sincere apologies for the mix-up on your chocolate box order. It was clear what you ordered us but we mistakenly sent you a box of cookies . We wish we had realized it earlier. We are sending you chocolate box in no time. You need not return the box you received. Thank you for your understanding We are looking forward to serving you again. Kevin Robinson Interflora , Customer Services Manager 3 I sincerely apologize for replying late to your e-mail. I couldn’t respond earlier because our company has been moving to another building for a few days and this led to communication problems. If only we could have solved the problem earlier.  We are terribly sorry for the inconvenience caused due to the delay in replying to your e-mail promptly and we assure you that this will never happen again. Mary Miller 4 Dear Sarah, I’m terribly sorry for not being able to help you with your final project. I had promised you beforehand but I was so busy with organizing my sister’s wedding ceremony that I couldn’t give you a hand. I wish I had let you know about it. If you had known, possibly  you could have planned your schedule or found another solution.  I’m deeply sorry. If you have time, my sister and I would apreciate your coming to the wedding ceremony. Thanks for your understanding. Jessica. A) - B) - C) - D) - E) - A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15764

Please accept my sincere apology for missing our lunch date yesterday. In the middle of the rush, I overlooked our appointment. Can we make another appointment for next week? I enjoy being together and it gives me a much-needed break from the stress here at the office. Let's meet at Sam's Cafe at noon next Tuesday; it will be my compensation.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

A) - B) - C) - D) - E) - A B C D E

Soru 1: 15768

Robert Hello, it’s Robert speaking. Can I speak to Jason?

Jason Hi, Robert! It’s me, Jason. Are you feeling better today?

Robert Yeah, thank you for your interest. I just want to (I) ………. for last night. I shouldn’t have behaved so rude. You know I was really sad and sought somebody to put the blame on.

Jason Well, don’t worry. I wish Judy had told you about it before.

Robert You’re right! She should have told me before but it was my (II) ……….. I’m terribly sorry, I didn’t mean to (III) ………. you. Please accept my apology!

Jason Don’t mind! We’re buddies, you know. Your apology will be accepted but first you have to speak to Judy about last night.
